qas.question: Pop Songwriter of the Year award in 2001 was awarded to whom?
Beyonce received the Pop Songwriter of the Year award at which event?

answers.text: American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers Pop Music Awards

qas.question: Beyonce has the same number of writing credits on number one singles as whom?
Beyonce joined 2 other women on what list from Billboard magazine in 2011?
When did Beyonce become the first African American woman to win Pop songwriter of the year?
What place is she tied for in songwriting credits?
Who listed her at number 17 in their list of  Top 20 hot 100 Songwriters?
Where does she place in writing credits  for three number one songs?
What did Beyoncé win in 2001, making her the first black woman to do so?

answers.text: Pop Songwriter of the Year award

qas.question: Who gave Beyoncé the Pop Songwriter of the Year award in 2001?

answers.text: the American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers Pop Music Awards.

qas.question: Beyoncé was one of how many women on Billboard magazine's 2011 "Top 20 Hot 100 Songwriters" list.
What number was Beyoncé on the Top 20 Hot 100 Songwriters list?

context: In <a4_0>2001<a4_0/>, she became the first African-American woman and second woman songwriter to win the <a8_0>Pop Songwriter of the Year award<a8_0/> at <a9_0>the <a1_0>American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers Pop Music Awards<a1_0/>.<a9_0/> <a0_0>Beyoncé<a0_0/> was the <a5_0><a7_0>third<a5_0/> woman<a7_0/> to have writing credits on <a10_0>three<a10_0/> number one songs ("Irreplaceable", "Grillz" and "Check on It") in the same year, after Carole King in 1971 and Mariah Carey in 1991. She is tied with American songwriter <a2_0>Diane Warren<a2_0/> at third with nine songwriting credits on number-one singles. (The latter wrote her 9/11-motivated song "I Was Here" for 4.) In May 2011, <a6_0>Billboard magazine<a6_0/> listed Beyoncé at number <a11_0>17<a11_0/> on their list of the "<a3_0>Top 20 Hot 100 Songwriters<a3_0/>", for having co-written eight singles that hit number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. She was one of only three women on that list.
